Questions.question: If the ratio of boys to girls in a class is 3:2 and there are 30 boys, how many girls are there?
Divide $2000 between two people in the ratio 3:2. How much does the second person get?
If the ratio of the ages of A and B is 4:5, and A is 24 years old, how old is B?
In a recipe, the ratio of sugar to flour is 1:4. If you use 2 cups of sugar, how many cups of flour are needed?
The ratio of men to women in a company is 5:3. If there are 40 women, how many men are there?
Two numbers are in the ratio 2:3. If the sum of the numbers is 50, what is the larger number?
The ratio of milk to water in a mixture is 4:1. If the total mixture is 25 liters, how much milk is there?
A mixture contains acid and water in the ratio 5:3. If the total quantity of the mixture is 64 liters, how much acid is present?
If the ratio of the length to the width of a rectangle is 7:3 and the width is 12 cm, what is the length?
If the ratio of two numbers is 9:7 and their difference is 14, what is the larger number?
The ratio of A’s salary to B’s salary is 4:5. If A’s salary is increased by 20%, the new ratio becomes 6:7. What is B’s original salary if A’s original salary was $2400?
A solution contains water and alcohol in the ratio 3:2. If 10 liters of alcohol is added, the new ratio becomes 1:1. What was the original amount of water?
A sum of money is divided among A, B, and C in the ratio 2:3:5. If C’s share is $500, what is the total amount of money?
The ratio of two quantities is 7:9. If 3 is added to both, the ratio becomes 5:6. What is the smaller quantity?
Two numbers are in the ratio 3:4. If 12 is subtracted from both, the ratio becomes 5:7. What are the two numbers?
A and B invest in a business in the ratio 3:2. If the total profit is $500, what is A's share?
A, B, and C invest in a business. A invests $5000, B invests $4000, and C invests $6000. If the total profit is $1500, what is C’s share of the profit?
A invests $8000 in a business for 6 months, and B invests $6000 for 8 months. What is the ratio of their profits?
A, B, and C invest in a business. A invests $5000 for 6 months, B invests $4000 for 12 months, and C invests $6000 for 8 months. What is the ratio of their profits?
A, B, and C invest in a partnership and divide the profits equally. If C invests double the amount of A and B, how are the profits divided?
A milkman mixes 30 liters of water with 70 liters of milk. What is the ratio of water to milk in the mixture?
A 40-liter solution contains 25% alcohol. How much alcohol should be added to make the alcohol content 40%?
Two alloys contain gold and silver in the ratio 2:3 and 5:7 respectively. In what ratio should the two alloys be mixed to get a new alloy with gold and silver in the ratio 7:10?
In a partnership, A invests $3000, B invests $4000, and C invests $5000. If the total profit is $1800, what is B's share?
A and B start a business. A invests $6000 and B invests $4000. At the end of the year, they earn a profit of $1000. If A's share of the profit is $600, what is B's share?
A 60-liter solution contains 40% alcohol. How much water must be added to reduce the alcohol percentage to 30%?
A and B invest in a business. A invests $1000 and B invests $2000. They make a profit of $1500. What is B's share of the profit?
A vessel contains a mixture of milk and water in the ratio 5:3. How much water should be added to 40 liters of the mixture to make the ratio 1:1?
A and B start a business with investments in the ratio 7:5. If A's share of the profit is $7000, what is the total profit?
A man bought 60 kg of sugar, part of which he sold at 20% profit and the rest at 10% loss. If he neither gains nor loses overall, what was the quantity of sugar sold at 10% loss?
What is 20% of 150?
If 45% of a number is 81, what is the number?
A student scores 72 out of 80 in an exam. What is his percentage score?
A shopkeeper marks his goods at 20% above the cost price and offers a discount of 10%. What is the percentage profit?
A number is first increased by 10% and then decreased by 10%. What is the overall change?
If a price is reduced by 20%, what percentage increase is required to restore it to the original price?
If A’s salary is 20% more than B’s, how much is B’s salary less than A’s in percentage terms?
In an election, a candidate secured 40% of the votes and lost by a margin of 200 votes. How many total votes were cast?
A person spends 80% of his income. If his income increases by 20%, but he continues to spend the same percentage of his income, what is the percentage increase in his savings?
The population of a town increases by 10% in the first year, and then decreases by 10% in the second year. What is the net change in the population over the two years?
A student scored 40% on a test and failed by 20 marks. If the passing marks are 50%, what was the maximum number of marks on the test?
If 60% of a number is added to 60, the result is the same number. What is the number?
A retailer offers a discount of 20% on a marked price and still makes a profit of 25%. What is the cost price if the marked price is $500?
If the price of a commodity increases by 20% every year, by what percentage will the price increase in 3 years?
The price of an article is first increased by 25% and then decreased by 20%. What is the net effect on the price?
What is the profit if a product is bought for $50 and sold for $70?
A shirt costs $40. If it is sold for $30, what is the loss percentage?
If a product is sold for $150 after a 25% discount, what was its original price?
A shopkeeper bought an item for $120 and sold it for $150. What is the profit percentage?
If an item is marked at $80 and is sold at a 10% discount, what is the selling price?
A bicycle is purchased for $300. If it is sold for $240, what is the loss percentage?
What is the cost price if a product is sold for $240 at a profit of 20%?
A laptop is priced at $800. If it is sold for $680, what is the percentage discount?
If a book is bought for $15 and sold for $18, what is the profit in dollars?
An article is sold for $1,200 after a 20% discount. What was the original price?
If an item is bought for $150 and sold for $120, what is the loss amount?
A store sells a jacket for $120 after applying a 25% discount. What was the original price?
A shopkeeper marks the price of a table at $500 but offers a 15% discount. What is the sale price?
If a trader incurs a loss of 10% on an item bought for $200, what is the selling price?
A toy is sold for $30 after a discount of 25%. What was the original price?
A car travels 60 kilometers in 1 hour. What is its speed in km/h?
If a cyclist covers 20 km in 40 minutes, what is their speed in km/h?
A train moves at a speed of 90 km/h. How far will it travel in 2.5 hours?

How long will it take a boat traveling at 15 km/h to cover 45 km?

If a cyclist travels 45 km in 1.5 hours, what is their speed in m/s?
A runner completes a marathon (42.195 km) in 3 hours. What is their average speed?
If a vehicle travels 360 km in 5 hours, what is its average speed?
A person jogs 8 km in 40 minutes. What is their speed in km/h?

In terms of railways, what does ' gauge' refer to?

A boat travels upstream at 10 km/h and downstream at 15 km/h. What is the average speed of the boat for the entire journey?
If a boat can go 24 km upstream in 3 hours, what is the speed of the boat in still water if the current speed is 4 km/h?
A boat takes 4 hours to travel downstream and 6 hours to return upstream. If the distance is the same in both cases, what is the speed of the boat in still water?
Two boats start from the same point. Boat A travels upstream at 5 km/h, and Boat B travels downstream at 10 km/h. How far apart will they be after 1 hour?
A boat can travel 30 km upstream in 6 hours. How fast is the current if the speed of the boat in still water is 8 km/h?
If a boat's speed in still water is 20 km/h and the speed of the current is 5 km/h, how long will it take to cover 60 km upstream?
A boat travels 15 km upstream and 15 km downstream in 3 hours. What is the speed of the current?
A boat moves at a speed of 12 km/h in still water. If it takes 2 hours longer to go upstream than downstream, how far did it travel?
A boat can travel downstream at 20 km/h and upstream at 10 km/h. If the total distance covered is 120 km, how much time does it take?
If a boat goes 40 km downstream in 2 hours, what is the speed of the boat in still water if the current speed is 5 km/h?
A boat covers a distance of 45 km downstream in 1.5 hours. How long will it take to cover the same distance upstream if the speed of the current is 3 km/h?
If a boat's speed in still water is 18 km/h and it travels 54 km downstream, how long will it take?
A boat takes 8 hours to travel downstream and 10 hours to return upstream. If the current is 2 km/h, what is the speed of the boat in still water?
If the speed of a boat is increased by 5 km/h, it can cover a distance of 100 km in 2 hours less. What was the original speed of the boat?
A boat takes 3 hours to cover a certain distance upstream and 2 hours to cover the same distance downstream. What is the ratio of the speed of the boat in still water to the speed of the current?
What is the simple interest on a principal amount of $1,000 at a rate of 5% per annum for 3 years?
If you invest $500 at an interest rate of 8% per annum, how much interest will you earn in 5 years?
Calculate the compound interest on $1,200 at an annual interest rate of 6% compounded annually for 2 years.
A principal of $800 is invested at a compound interest rate of 10% per annum for 3 years. What is the total amount at the end of 3 years?

What will be the total amount after 4 years if $1,500 is invested at 5% compound interest per annum?

How long will it take for a principal amount to triple at a rate of 6% per annum compound interest?

If $3,000 is invested at an annual interest rate of 9% compounded annually, how much will it amount to after 5 years?

Calculate the total amount on an investment of $2,500 at a compound interest rate of 5% compounded quarterly for 3 years.
If Pipe A can fill a tank in 10 hours, how long will it take for Pipe A to fill half the tank?
If Pipe B can fill a tank in 15 hours, how many hours will it take to fill the tank if Pipe B is open for 3 hours?
Pipe A can fill a tank in 8 hours, and Pipe B can fill it in 12 hours. How long will it take for both pipes to fill the tank together?
If Pipe C empties a tank in 20 hours, how long will it take for the tank to be emptied if Pipe C works for 5 hours?
If Pipe D can fill a tank in 5 hours and Pipe E can empty it in 10 hours, how long will it take for both pipes to fill the tank if they are opened together?
A tank is filled by two pipes in 6 hours. If one pipe is twice as fast as the other, how long does it take for the slower pipe to fill the tank alone?
Pipe F fills a tank at a rate of 4 liters per minute. How long will it take to fill a 240-liter tank?
If Pipe G fills a tank in 3 hours and Pipe H fills it in 5 hours, how long will it take to fill the tank if both pipes work together?
A tank is filled by three pipes. Pipe I can fill it in 4 hours, Pipe J in 6 hours, and Pipe K in 12 hours. How long will it take for all three pipes to fill the tank together?
If Pipe L is opened and fills a tank in 7 hours, and Pipe M is opened and empties it in 14 hours, how long will it take to fill the tank if both pipes are opened together?
If a tank can be filled by Pipe N in 9 hours and Pipe O can empty it in 3 hours, how long will it take to fill the tank if both are working together?
A tank takes 15 hours to fill when both Pipe P and Pipe Q are opened together. If Pipe P is twice as fast as Pipe Q, how long does it take Pipe Q to fill the tank alone?
If Pipe R can fill a tank in 10 hours and Pipe S can fill it in 15 hours, how long will it take to fill the tank if Pipe S is turned off after 3 hours?
A tank has two pipes. Pipe T can fill it in 8 hours, while Pipe U can empty it in 10 hours. If both are opened together, how long will it take to fill the tank?
If a tank is filled by Pipe V in 12 hours and emptied by Pipe W in 18 hours, how long will it take to fill the tank if both are opened together?

In a class of 30 students, the average score in a test is 75. What is the total score of the class?
A person has an average speed of 40 km/h for the first 2 hours and 60 km/h for the next 3 hours. What is his average speed for the entire journey?
The average weight of 4 boys is 45 kg. If one boy weighs 50 kg, what is the average weight of the remaining boys?
A family has an average income of $5000 per month. If they spend $3000, what is their average savings?

What is the average of the first five prime numbers?

In a box, there are 8 red balls and 12 blue balls. What is the average number of balls?

Which of the following is true for all prime numbers?
option: They have exactly two distinct positive divisors
They can be divided by 1 only
Questions.answer: They have exactly two distinct positive divisors
